sentences.en: Absence diminishes mediocre passions and increases great ones ( La Rochefoucauld ).
sentences.cn: 分别会使平庸的感情削减,却能使深厚的感情增强 ( 拉劳土福科 ).

sentences.en: But Mediocre Man is always just " good enough " to remain employed.
sentences.cn: 但庸才们总是能做的 “ 足够好 ”,以至于刚好不会被解雇.

sentences.en: Good results combined with mediocre training usually indicate untapped potential.
sentences.cn: 好的结果结合平庸的训练通常表示潜能并未被开发.

sentences.en: Great spirits have always encountered violent opposition from mediocre minds.
sentences.cn: 伟大的灵魂总会遭到庸人的强烈反对.

sentences.en: He is a man of something less than mediocre abilities.
sentences.cn: 他是个才能略低于一般的人.

sentences.en: How can we produce top-class engineers when universities are constrained to offer salaries that can only attract mediocre staff?
sentences.cn: 大学的财力有限，提供的薪酬仅能吸引水平一般的教师，在这种情况下，我们如何能培养出一流的工程师？

sentences.en: I frequently reflect that this mediocre group was assembling at the same spot.
sentences.cn: 我不由地经常想到这些凡夫俗子们呆的地方.

sentences.en: I have ground out some verses , which, I'm afraid, are too mediocre to appear in your publication.
sentences.cn: 我搜索枯肠做了几句诗, 恐怕过于平淡,不配在你们刊物上发表.

sentences.en: I thought the book was pretty mediocre.
sentences.cn: 我认为这本书非常一般。

sentences.en: I thought the play was only mediocre.
sentences.cn: 我认为这部戏剧只是平庸之作。

sentences.en: Only lazybones and mediocre persons could hanker after the days of messing together.
sentences.cn: 只有懒汉庸才才会留恋那大锅饭的年代.

sentences.en: Sensitive souls were writing mediocre romances.
sentences.cn: 敏感的人们都在写平淡无奇的传奇故事.

sentences.en: Some people actually remain obscure, do not the achievement, the mediocre life.
sentences.cn: 有的人却默默无闻, 无所成就, 平庸一生.

sentences.en: The caliber of the students has gone from mediocre to above average.
sentences.cn: 学生的品质已经从平庸水平升到了超出一般的水平.

sentences.en: Virginia was a perfectionist. She was just not prepared to settle for anything mediocre.
sentences.cn: 弗吉尼娅是个完美主义者，她根本不愿意拿任何普普通通毫无特色的东西将就。

trans.tran_cn: 普通的，中等的，质量中等偏下的
